lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/core.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run core.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the specified deadline task.
* @param task The deadline task to be added.
* Executes the command to add the given deadline task to the task list and update storage.
* @param tasks   The task list that the task will be added to.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to update with the new task information.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.add(task);             // Add task to the task list
storage.addLine(task.toString()); // Update storage with the new task
* Represents a command to add an event task to the task list.

* @param storage The storage to update with the new task information.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.add(task);             // Add task to the task list
storage.addLine(task.toString()); // Update storage with the new task

storage.addLine(task.toString()); // Update storage with the new task
* The interface representing a command that can be executed on the task list.
* Executes the command on the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks   The task list on which the command will be executed.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to update as needed by the command.
void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* The regular expression pattern for matching the format of a delete command.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified position of the task to delete.
* @param pos The position of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the command to delete the task at the specified position from the task list.
* @param tasks   The task list from which the task will be deleted.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to update as needed by the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.delete(pos); // Delete task from the task list
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the command to exit the application.
* @param tasks   The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface to handle the application exit.
* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.exit(); // Instruct the user interface to exit the application

* Represents a command to display help information and usage examples.
* Executes the command to display help information and usage examples to the user.
* @param tasks   The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface to display help messages.
* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Sorry, I don't understand what do you mean.");
ui.showMessage("Here are some sample usages for your reference:");
ui.showMessage("1. Add a deadline to your list: deadline + (description) + (deadline)");
ui.showMessage("2. Add a todo task to your list: todo + (description)");
ui.showMessage("3. Add an event task to your list: event + (description) + from + "
ui.showMessage("4. Delete a task: delete + (line number)");
ui.showMessage("5. Mark a task: mark + (line number)");
ui.showMessage("6. Unmark a class: unmark + (line number)");
ui.showMessage("content in ( ) is for you to fill out");
* Represents a command to handle invalid user input by displaying an error message.
* Constructs an InvalidCommand with the specified error message.
* @param errorMessage The error message to be displayed.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to display the list of tasks to the user.
* Executes the command to display the list of tasks to the user.
* @param tasks   The task list to be displayed.
* @param ui      The user interface to display the list of tasks.
* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.print(); // Display the list of tasks through the user interface
* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified position of the task to mark.
* @param pos The position of the task to be marked.
* The regular expression pattern for matching the format of a mark command.
* Executes the command to mark the task at the specified position as done in the task list.
* If the position is invalid, an error message is displayed.
* @param tasks   The task list in which the task will be marked as done.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to update as needed by the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.mark(pos);        // Mark the task as done in the task list
Storage.refresh(tasks); // Update storage with the modified task list
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the task list.
* The regular expression pattern for matching the format of an unmark command.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified position of the task to unmark.
* @param pos The position of the task to be unmarked.
* Executes the command to unmark the task at the specified position as not done in the task list.
* If the position is invalid, an error message is displayed through the user interface.
* @param tasks   The task list in which the task will be unmarked.
* @param ui      The user interface to display error messages.
* @param storage The storage to update as needed by the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
tasks.unmark(pos);      // Unmark the task in the task list
Storage.refresh(tasks); // Update storage with the modified task list
* Duke is a task management application that interacts with users through a command-line interface.
* It allows users to manage tasks by adding, marking, and deleting tasks from a task list.

* @param filepath The filepath for task storage.

* The application continues running until the user inputs an exit command.

* The DataParser is responsible for parsing data from storage
* files and converting them into Task objects.

* Parses a line representing a deadline task and converts it into a Deadline object.
* @param line The line representing the deadline task.
* @return A Deadline object corresponding to the parsed line.
int descriptionStart = "deadline".length() + 1; // Length of "deadline" plus the space
boolean isMarked = line.charAt(4) == 'X'; // Assuming index 4 corresponds to the "[ ]" checkmark
* Parses a line representing an event task and converts it into an Event object.
* @param line The line representing the event task.
* @return An Event object corresponding to the parsed line.
int descriptionStart = line.indexOf("] ") + 2; // Index of the first character after "] "
int startFromIndex = line.indexOf("from ") + 6; // Index of the character after "from: "
int toIndex = line.indexOf("to ", startFromIndex); // Index of the character before "to: "
int endFromIndex = toIndex + 4; // Index of the character after "to: "
boolean isMarked = line.charAt(4) == 'X'; // Assuming index 4 corresponds to the "[ ]" checkmark
return new Event(description, start, end, isMarked);
* Parses a line representing a todo task and converts it into a ToDo object.
* @param line The line representing the todo task.
* @return A ToDo object corresponding to the parsed line.
int descriptionStart = line.indexOf("] ") + 2; // Index of the first character after "] "
boolean isMarked = line.charAt(4) == 'X'; // Assuming index 4 corresponds to the "[ ]" checkmark
